parse.title: List of first minority male lawyers and judges in Texas

text.*:
This is a list of the first minority male lawyer(s) and judge(s) in Texas. It includes the year in which the men were admitted to practice law (in parentheses). Also included are other distinctions such as the first minority men in their state to obtain a law degree or become a political figure.

Contents

  • 1 Firsts in state history
  • 2 Firsts in local history
  • 3 See also
  • 4 References

Firsts in state history[edit]

  • Allen W. Wilder (1873)[1][2][3][4] First African American male lawyer in Texas
  • William A. Price (1873):[5] First African American male judge in Texas
  • James DeAnda (1950):[6] First Hispanic American male appointed as a Judge of the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of Texas (1979)
  • Wellington Chew (1951):[7] First Chinese American male lawyer in Texas
  • Hipolito Frank Garcia (1951):[8] First Hispanic American male appointed as a Judge of the U.S. District Court for the Western District of Texas (1979)
  • Raul A. Gonzalez Jr. (1966):[9] First Hispanic American male appointed as an Associate Justice of the Texas Supreme Court in 1984
  • Morris Overstreet (1975):[10] First African American male appointed as a Judge of the Texas Court of Criminal Appeals (1991)
  • Sam A. Lindsay (1977):[11] First African American male appointed as a Judge of the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of Texas (particularly Dallas, Texas; 1998)
  • Craig Watkins (1994):[12] First African American male elected as a District Attorney in Texas (2006)
  • Wallace B. Jefferson:[13] First African American male appointed as a Justice of the Texas Supreme Court (2001) and Chief Justice (2004)

Firsts in local history[edit]

Alphabetized by county name

  • Ramey Ko:[14][15] First Asian American male judge in Austin County and Travis County, Texas (2010)
  • Orange Hicks:[16] First African American male Justice of the Peace in Bastrop County, Texas (1888)
  • Ronnie McDonald:[17] First African American male judge in Bastrop County, Texas (1999)
  • George W. Fremont (1879):[18] First African American male lawyer in San Antonio, Texas Bexar County, Texas, Medina County, Texas, and Comal County, Texas
  • Abel Toscano Jr. (1952):[19] First Hispanic American male lawyer in Harlingen, Texas Cameron County, Texas
  • S.H. Scott (1881):[20] First African American male lawyer in Dallas, Texas. It was long believed that Joseph Edwin Wiley was the first African American male lawyer in that city. Dallas County, Texas
  • Louis A. Bedford Jr. (1951):[21] First African American male judge in Dallas County, Texas (1966)
  • Richard Abalos (c. 1970s):[22] First Hispanic American male lawyer in Odessa, Texas Ector County, Texas
  • Frank Feuille, Jr:[23] First male lawyer of French descent in El Paso, Texas El Paso County, Texas
  • Joe Calamia:[23] First male lawyer of Italian descent in El Paso, Texas El Paso, Texas
  • Frank Galvan:[24] Reputed to be the first Mexican American male lawyer in El Paso, Texas El Paso County, Texas
  • Armando V. Rodriguez:[25] First Hispanic American judge in the municipal court of Houston, Texas and to be appointed as the Harris County Justice of the Peace by Commissioners Court Harris County, Texas, Fort Bend County, Texas, and Montgomery County, Texas
  • John N. Johnson:[26] First African American male lawyer in Austin, Texas Hays County, Texas, Travis County, Texas, and Williamson County, Texas
  • Donald J. Floyd:[27] First male judge (and African American) appointed to the Court at-law in Jefferson County, Texas
  • Gregorio Coronado (1957):[28] First Hispanic American male lawyer in Lubbock, Texas Lubbock County, Texas
  • Sam Medina (1976):[28] First Hispanic American male appointed as a Judge of County Court (1995) and serve as Presiding Judge of the 237th District Court (1998) Lubbock County, Texas
  • George C. Thomas:[29][30] First Indian American male judge in Travis County, Texas
  • Manuel Velasco:[31] First Mexican American male lawyer in Victoria, Texas Victoria County, Texas
  • Dewayne Charleston:[32] First African American male judge in Waller County, Texas
  • Oscar Cavazos (c. 1951):[33] First Hispanic American male lawyer in Willacy County, Texas

See also[edit]

  • List of first minority male lawyers and judges in the United States
